tool.name: muTect
tool.command: muTect.py --reference-sequence $reference #if str($cosmic) != "": --cosmic $cosmic #end if #if str($dbsnp) != "": --dbsnp $dbsnp #end if --input_file:normal $normal --input_file:index:normal $normal.metadata.bam_index --input_file:tumor $tumor --input_file:index:tumor $tumor.metadata.bam_index --out call_stats.txt --coverage_file coverage.wig.txt --vcf mutations.vcf --workdir ./ --ncpus \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4}

param.name: intervals
param.label: Intervals to process
param.help: In format 'chr1:1500-2500; chr2:2500-3500', separated by semicolons

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**License**
Copyright (c) 2012 The Broad Institute Please view our documentation at http://www.broadinstitute.org/gsa/wiki For support, please view our support site at http://getsatisfaction.com/gsa
**What it does**
MuTect is a method developed at the Broad Institute for the reliable and accurate identification of somatic point mutations in next generation sequencing data of cancer genomes.
**Input**
Reference Genome:
Fasta file of ref gnome
Normal Sample:
bam normal sample
Tumor Sample:
bam tumor sample
Intervals:
A list of genomic intervals over which to operate.
**Output**
Caller Output:
Detailed caller output
Coverage Output:
write out coverage in WIGGLE format to this file
VCF Output:
VCF output of mutation calls
